results.title: Food for thought
results.creator_credit: R. Ronald Brown, Christopher Tate, Gerald Wilson, Michel Laloride and Century II Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: Television personality Blake Emmons presents the safe handling of food in the home, based on two principles - the time and temperature rule and the cross contamination rule.

results.title: Follow the leader
results.brief_description: A supervisory training film which makes use of puppets. Designed to increase employee pride in and identification with the organisation. It also aims to make employees understand and be proud of their job and their skill at performing it.

results.title: Folk art
results.brief_description: Shows a variety of home crafts. A wood carver creating complex scenes and individual figures; women painting the walls of their homes with brightly colored floral designs; a potter making and decorating attractive pieces of pottery; expert needle women designing and working intricate pieces of embroidery.

results.title: Focus on precision
results.brief_description: Although large-scale production accounts for the major part of Britain’s industrial output, there is still need for the precision work of the craftsman. This film concentrates on the manufacture of lenses in a world-famous Leicester factory. The delicate machines and instruments needed for the production of lenses of all types must be handled by highly skilled workers. Scenes are included which illustrate the various uses to which lenses are put.

results.title: Focus on Marijuana
results.creator_credit: Noel Nosseck, American Educational Films, Avanti Films and Directions Unlimited
results.brief_description: This film is a dramatised story about peer pressure amidst young people of varying socio-economic levels to smoke marijuana. Encourages potential “pot” users to think for themselves before making a decision which could affect the rest of their lives. Written by Max Miller.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Noel Nosseck, American Educational Films, Avanti Films and Directions Unlimited

results.title: Focus on Ethiopia
results.brief_description: A survey of the growth of Ethiopia since the war. Scenes are given of new building, educational and agricultural programs which are now under way. The recent history of the country is traced from the beginning of the 20th century, including newsreel sequences of the Italo-Ethiopian war. Under the leadership of Emperor Haile Selassie the country is being prepared to take an important place in world affairs.

results.title: Focus on downers
results.creator_credit: Noel Nosseck and American Educational Films
results.brief_description: Vignettes illustrate how barbiturates can lead to death when they cause the user to forget how many they have taken, when they are taken with alcohol or when the user attempts to drive. Questions use by young people, and discusses barbiturate withdrawal.
results.description: Vignettes illustrate how barbiturates can lead to death when they cause the user to forget how many they have taken, when they are taken with alcohol or when the user attempts to drive. Questions use by young people, and discusses barbiturate withdrawal.

results.title: Flying: a dream come true
results.brief_description: Shows gliding enthusiasts building their planes, their training and techniques. The Wasser-Kuppe Hill in the Rhoen mountains is a popular resort for gliders. The weightless flight, an old dream of man’s has persisted in spite of the innovation of the motor driven aircraft.

results.title: Flutter and its prevention
results.brief_description: The significance of “flutter” in aerodynamics and its drastic results, ie aeroplane crash. Ways to prevent flutter and therefore avoid aircraft accidents and loss of life and valuable property.

results.title: Flute, clarinet and bassoon
results.brief_description: Introduces three of the woodwind instruments and illustrates the principle by which each produces a musical sound. How a scale is produced by the opening and closing of holes is demonstrated through diagrams and close-ups of each instrument. The instruments are played separately, in pairs and as a trio.
